item.description: “…Rehoboth…” Anchor Text: Genesis 26:1-22, 23-30. There are different stations in the walk of a man with His God. Abraham, for example, travelled from Ur of the Chaldeans through Haran Egypt, Philistine to Canaan. Different landscapes had different connotations, demands and challenges. Similarly, Isaac traversed different terrains. God interrupted him in an attempted economic relocation to Egypt like Abraham, his father.

item.title: New Year Message: Marching on into the Year 2022.
item.description: Marching on into the Year 2022 Texts: Numbers 21:1-9; Psalm 2:1-4. Life is a journey that is measured in time and season. And in the journey of life, there are contentions and challenges. Our pilgrims‚Äô journey cannot be void of attacks, battles and rages from the enemy. If there is nothing good about your journey in life, the enemy will not trouble you.

item.title: Letter to Young Mr Youth 2 (Youth Series).
item.description: 1.1¬†The Valley of Dry Bones ü¶¥ü¶¥ We have never heard of the mountain of dry bones but we have read of the valley of dry bones. Whose dead bones, were they? Men who once pursued their visions with vigour, self-determination. Men who conceived their dreams with crystal clear vision and articulated them.

item.title: Letter to Young Mr Youth 1 (Youth Series).
item.description: 1¬†Dear Young Mr Youth There are two peaks in life: the dream peak and the attainment peak. The dream peak magnifies the attainment peak to make it real and pursuable. But unfortunately minifies the valleys in between. So, the youth is tricked to think that bright visions equal their achievement in life.

item.title: Mystery of Godliness 12
item.description: KNOWING THIS‚Ä¶ (Romans 6:6) The majority of believers today are destroyed not because they pray; not because they fast; not because they do good deeds. But according to the Bible, God says, ‚ÄòMy people are destroyed for lack of knowledge. As good as self-discipline and rules in dealing with a problem are, they are only human efforts in dealing with the Old Man.

item.title: Absalom is Dead (Final Part)
item.description: Absalom is dead (Final Part ) Key texts: 11 Sam 18:33; 19:1-12; Rom.6:6-7 (KJV) What to do. As we bring this article to a conclusion, I could see Joab was telling David what to do just as the Holy Spirit is presently speaking through various holy men and women what your response ought to be: God is speaking through Chats, songs, visions, dreams, prophecies, messages,; ‚ÄòNow therefore arise, go forth, and speak comfortably to thy servants‚Ä¶‚Äô What is God saying to you?

item.title: Absalom is Dead 3
item.description: Absalom is dead (Part 3) Key texts: 11 Sam 18:33; 19:1-12; Rom.6:6-7 (KJV) The case of Absalom. Beloved, from this narrative the clear picture emerging, is that first, the Old Man deserves death so that mankind can live for the Lord. Hence, whatever represents the character, conduct, and conversation of the Absalom**‚Äì (Old Man**) in your life must be terminated before you can be useful unto God and His Kingdom.

item.title: Absalom is Dead 2
item.description: Absalom is dead (Part 2) Key texts: 11 Sam 18:33; 19:1-12; Rom.6:6-7 Who is this Old Man? At this stage, there is a quiet introduction of the Old Man. And this created another species of mankind different from the innocent Adam that God created in Genesis 2. Subsequently from this point, we will be looking at the nature of this fallen man and its application to the narrative on Absalom.

item.title: Absalom is Dead 1
item.description: Absalom is dead Texts: 11 Sam 18:33; 19:1-12. Let me begin by pointing your attention to the name ‚ÄòAbsalom‚Äô. It is interesting to note here that the name Absalom means, ‚ÄòThe father of Peace‚Äô. But sadly, you will discover that his lifestyle was a complete contrast to the true meaning of his name.

item.title: Mystery of Godliness 10
item.description: WHAT ARE THE PROVISIONS? Since anything that comes with the sinful nature cannot please God, it means that God had a plan to deal with sins and the sinful nature. God truly does not want to bestow unending fame upon Mr. flesh at all. So, He made adequate provision for us to experience total deliverance from it.

item.title: Mystery of Godliness 9
item.description: KEY TEXT: Rev. 12:10-11 (NKJV). So, for you to overcome the devil and his constant accusations, it is not by your own effort but by the ‚ÄúBlood of the Lamb and by the Word of your testimony.‚Äù It is not by shouting; talking about it; not by speaking in tongues; not by covering it up.

item.title: Mystery of Godliness 8
item.description: 1.1: THE THREE ASPECTS OF MAN Mankind is of three components: A man has a spirit, with a soul inside the body. (1Thess. 5:23). THE SPIRIT (Consist of our Intuition, fellowship and conscience) – The Generating/Manufacturing Centre. THE SOUL (Comprises of our Intellect, Will and Emotion – The Warehouse.

item.title: Mystery of Godliness 7
item.description: 1 .1¬†THE SINFUL NATURE As we continue this lesson, please note that the original man and the woman GOD made in His own image in Genesis 2, is not the same as the one in Gen 3. Sin drew away the sinless life from this container (our body) and another life (sinful nature) invaded this human body.

item.title: Mystery of Godliness 6
item.description: The fundamental issue of being born again was raised by Christ before Nicodemus in John 3. This was because of the kind of life Nicodemus carried, but he was not aware of it. The problem with mankind is the specie of life he carries about in this earthen vessel. Mankind is not aware of the fallen nature dwelling within him, because nothing happened to the body (the container).

item.title: Too Late
item.description: You can seek and find God too late, Know Jesus and the faith too late, Realize the value of life too late, Appreciate the reach of mercy too late, Comprehend the use of grace too late. Alas! No one arrives eternity late, But on that cloudless day: Tears and sorrow for sin will be too late

item.title: Jesus the Son and the Father‚Äôs Companion
item.description: 1.1¬†Subsection (Section Title): Let me welcome you to this blog with prayer ‚Äú‚Ä¶ that the LORD will bless and keep you; He will quicken and enlighten the eyes of your inner man with His light from the realm of the wondrous Cross. May grace and truth help you to walk from day to day in the footprints of our Savior JESUS.

item.title: Leave a Legacy
item.description: 1.1¬†Gleanings from Matthew 25:14-21 First and foremost, we are on a pilgrimage and we cannot afford to be distracted along the way. We have nothing of our own and we don‚Äôt own our self. We are bought at a price fully paid. We belong to the Lord. We are living a ‚Äòborrowed life‚Äô, ‚Äòborrowed time‚Äô.

item.title: Mystery of Godliness 1
item.description: The Mystery of the Gospel 1.1¬†INTRODUCTION God in His love gave us¬†The¬†Gospel as His own¬†Divine instrument for changing men. We were all sinners, criminals and under the divine judgment of God to be sentenced to eternal death and total separation from God. But God the Father out of His great love sent God the Son-Jesus Christ to the earth in the likeness of human flesh to die for our sins.

item.title: Welcome Note
item.description: Dearly Beloved in Christ Jesus, it is with great pleasure I welcome you to the maiden edition of the article section. The good Lord has been gracious unto us to create this medium for us to reach one another in the unity of faith and the bond of one love in Christ Jesus.
